title: Samir Menon
main_content: Samir Menon menon.samir@gmail.com SWE at Apple , working in SEAR Previously: co-founder of Blyss , SWE at Yubico , research in the Stanford Applied Cryptography group I work in the Security Engineering and Architecture (SEAR) group at Apple , on TLS and related internet technologies. I previously co-founded Blyss with Neil Movva . We worked on running LLMs in hardware enclaves, and on an SDK for private information retrieval. Before that, I was a software engineer at Yubico , where I worked on secure device manufacturing and programming. I've also done research in homomorphic encryption and private information retrieval. Publications Respire: High-Rate PIR for Databases with Small Records Alexander Burton, Samir Jordan Menon, and David J. Wu ACM CCS 2024 YPIR: High-Throughput Single-Server PIR with Silent Preprocessing Samir Jordan Menon and David J. Wu USENIX Security 2024 Spiral: Fast, High-Rate Single-Server PIR via FHE Composition Samir Jordan Menon and David J. Wu Oakland (IEEE S&P) 2022 Background I got my B.S. and M.S. in Computer Science in 2019 from Stanford University; my tracks were Systems and Computer & Network Security. While there, I was a TA for Prof. Dan Boneh's CS 255 (cryptography) and CS 251 (blockchain) classes. I also did research in the Applied Cryptography group on speeding up lattice-based SNARKs .
